title: Business Live: US stocks advance - BBC News

documents.title: goodnight
text: that 's all from business live .
we 'll be back on monday at 6am .

documents.title: jcb announces 600 new jobs
text: it 's been a bad week for employees , with airbus , new look and babcock all proposing jobs cuts .
however , today construction equipment giant jcb announced it would create 600 new jobs .
a third of the temporary roles at the staffordshire-based firm will be available immediately .
the rest will be needed across the next 12 weeks for the firm 's production lines in rugeley , rocester , cheadle , as well as foston , derbyshire .
a local councillor described the news as a `` boost '' for the area .
read more

documents.title: wall street ends the week on a high
text: the three major us stock indexes ended up more than 1 % today , with the nasdaq hitting a record high , as february 's jobs report soothed fears of inflation and aggressive interest rate hikes .
the dow jones industrial average closed up 440.46 points , or 1.77 % , to 25,335.67 .
the nasdaq composite added 132.86 points , or 1.79 % , to 7,560.81 , while the s & p 500 rose 47.53 points , or 1.74 % , to 2,786.50 .

documents.title: trump 's steel tariffs : what harm could they do ?
text: trump 's steel tariffs : what harm could they do ?
none if the rest of you muppets comply like good little sheep that you are and get rug burns on your knees serving your overlord .
however if you man up and resist then that is another thing .
the uk want a weak eu so they are happy like pigs in slop .

documents.title: fake news 'travels faster ' than truth , study finds
text: fake news 'travels faster ' , study finds
this certainly travelled extra fast , eh bbc !
falsehood flies , and the truth comes limping after it . ''
jonathan swift 1710 , and numerous others after this .
was a study really necessary ?
there is a saying that a lie will travel halfway round the globe , before the truth puts the shoe on .
fake researchers are reinventing the wheel .
to be fair i just retweeted this article without reading it i think that kinda behaviour might be contributing factor
obviously .
fake news is often incendiary in nature , triggering responses , which snowball in kind .
likely down to the incredulity of it .

documents.title: us steel tariffs : germany 's merkel calls for eu exemption
text: german chancellor angela merkel has also called for the european union to be exempted from new us tariffs on steel and aluminium imports .
`` the best option would be [ for the eu ] to be excluded , '' she told business leaders gathered in munich .
ms merkel warned that no one could win a `` race to the bottom '' and said the tariffs risked `` hurting everyone '' .
president donald trump says the us has suffered from `` unfair trade '' and that the tariffs will boost industry .
read more

documents.title: us stocks power ahead
text: it 's been a good day on wall street .
strong us jobs figures , along with suggestions there could be fewer rate rises than expected this year , have pushed all the major indexes higher .
a cooling of tensions between north korea and the us also helped .
a short while ago the dow jones was up 1.5 % at 25,265.11 points , while the s & p 500 was 1.4 % higher at 2,777.54 .
the nasdaq has also advanced 1.5 % to 7,538.79 .

documents.title: macron hits out at trump tariffs
text: french president emmanuel macron has warned donald trump against forging ahead with planned tariffs on european steel and aluminium , saying it risked starting a mutually destructive `` trade war '' .

in a telephone call with mr trump , the french leader expressed his `` deep concerns '' over the measures , saying that while he shared mr trump 's concern over unfair trade practices , the tariffs due to come into effect in two weeks `` risked triggering a trade war , in which all affected countries would be losers '' .

documents.title: lady judge resignation 'a victory ' - iod director general
text: stephen martin , director general of the institute of directors , has come out swinging after lady judge accused the organisation of conspiratorial behaviour in her resignation letter .
ms judge , former chair of the iod , had been accused of racist , bullying behaviour - claims she denied .

mr martin said : this is a victory for ordinary staff members , who had the courage to risk jeopardising their careers , to speak out and make complaints about the conduct and language of people in very senior positions .
this is a victory also for good governance .

our hr department took these complaints seriously and instigated a truly independent process through an external law firm , which fully and fairly considered the allegations before producing their conclusion in a final report that the majority of the allegations were true .

today marks the start of a new era for the iod where we are freed to focus on modernisation , where we are able to share our learnings from this difficult challenge with other companies across the country who find themselves in extraordinary circumstances .
the new iod will strive to be even more supportive and collaborative , reflecting the culture of its courageous staff members . ''

documents.title: 'pharma bro ' martin shkreli sentenced to seven years
text: martin shkreli , the former drug firm executive found guilty of defrauding investors , has been sentenced to seven years in prison .
the 34-year-old wept at a hearing as a federal court judge in brooklyn , new york , handed down the prison term .
shkreli was convicted last year of sending fake account statements to investors while concealing huge losses from two hedge funds he ran .
he first became notorious in 2015 for hiking the price of a lifesaving drug .
read more

documents.title: marstons ' secret weapon
text: got that # fridayfeeling and looking forward to a wind down beer ?
how much difference does the pump clip make to your choice ?
find out how marstons increased the appeal of one of their traditional ales through the addition of one word # wakeuptomoney

documents.title: pressure mounts on ing over boss 's pay
text: dutch prime minister mark rutte has weighed in on a row about chief executive pay at ing , the country 's top bank .
on thursday the bank said it would give boss ralph hamers share rewards worth half his current salary of 1.75m euros .
joining a chorus of disapproval , mr rutte said : `` i think the wage increase is excessive it is unwise . ''
he also called it `` unhelpful '' for the bank 's reputation , given ing had to be bailed out by taxpayers during the 2008 financial crisis .
along with a 16 % bonus , mr hamers ' annual income will rise to more than 3m euros if the package is approved .

documents.title: have you ever dreamed of flying in your car ? bbc business news reporters theo leggett and matthew wall
text: as dutch company pal-v unveils its latest flying car gyrocopter at the geneva motor show , we ask if the dream of flying cars for all could ever become a reality .
`` 007 was here '' says the graffiti emblazoned on the wall of pal-v 's stand at the geneva motor show .
beneath it sits a creation james bond would certainly be proud of .
the dutch company has just launched its first flying car on to the market .
it 's a compact three-wheeler , which it says can offer sporty performance on the road then take to the air using a set of extendable rotors .
read more

documents.title: nigeria 's dessert-inspired beauty products
text: nigeria 's dessert-inspired beauty products

documents.title: goldman boss 'preparing to step down '
text: lloyd blankfein is preparing to step down as goldman sach 's chief executive , the wall street journal has reported , quoting people familiar with the matter .
it said the 63-year-old would retire ahead of or early in 2019 , capping a more than 12-year run at the investment bank .
the paper said there was likely to be a quick transfer of power to one of goldman 's two co-presidents , harvey schwartz and david solomon , although the timing of any moves could still change .

documents.title: saudi jet deal 'good for uk industry '
text: a preliminary agreement to sell 48 typhoon fighter jets to saudi arabia will be good for uk industry , says ads , a trade organisation for the aerospace sector .
boss paul everitt said : `` the memorandum of intent is welcome news for bae systems and its uk supply chain , which has a 37.5 % workshare on the typhoon programme .

today 's announcement , coupled with the mod 's work to develop a combat air strategy , will help ensure the uk remains a world leading military air power and a highly competitive and capable option in the export market . ''

documents.title: 'i deeply regret the language i used '
text: lady judge also attacked the leaking of a recording of a private conversation to the press , `` obtained by entrapment '' , but added :

although i strongly object to the breach of trust arising from the secret recording of a private conversation , i accept that the language used when discussing the employment situation of individuals with protected characteristics was not of the modern standard .
i deeply regret the language i used and apologise if this caused any distress or upset .
however , this in no way reflects my life long firm commitment to ethnic minorities , beginning with civil rights work in the 1970 's , and the promotion of women in the workplace .

documents.title: lady judge resignation letter
text: in her resignation letter , lady judge said she continued to `` strongly refute '' the allegations made against her .
she also said she was `` deeply disturbed by the gross and conspiratorial mishandling of the process which has lead to the damaging circumstances in which i and the institute are now placed . ''
shed said :
on wednesday i voluntarily agreed to step aside from my role as chair for the duration of the internal process that had been commenced against me .

the clear flaws in this process were identified in the statement i read to the council yesterday which included the institute 's failure to give me an opportunity to reply to the allegations , the leaking of a confidential legal document to the press and the misrepresentations made by the institute and its investigators to my legal advisors . ''

documents.title: breakingchair of the iod resigns
text: lady judge , chair of the institute of directors , and sir ken olisa , deputy chair , have resigned .
lady judge had been suspended pending an investigation into allegations of racist , sexist and bullying behaviour .
she contests the allegations and has accused the iod of smearing her reputation .
the iod met on thursday to discuss the contents of a report it commissioned into her alleged behaviour .

documents.title: facebook signs licencing deal with warner music
text: facebook has signed a licensing with warner music allowing it use any of the label 's music on its platforms .
under the deal facebook and instagram users will be able to post videos with music from warner music artists , including bruno mars ( and ed sheeran .
that includes the artists ' actual music videos as well as fan cover versions of hit songs or wedding dance videos .
music videos are already widely shared on facebook , but until recently this content was unlicensed .
this angered some big record labels which had taken legal action .
it comes as facebook battles for viewers with google 's youtube , the internet 's number one destination for music .
in recent months facebook has struck similar deals with universal music and sony/atv .

documents.title: why trump tariffs are illegal
text: # truimptariffs are illegal under wto rules for several reasons and the is undermining its own national security defence - james bacchus of @ twitterid and ex-chair of @ twitterid appellate body tells @ twitterid # tariffs # freetrade # steel # aluminium

documents.title: saudi poised to buy uk fighter planes
text: saudi arabia is poised to buy 48 typhoon eurofighter jets from britain 's bae systems .
the memorandum of intent was signed after saudi crown prince mohammed bin salman met with british defence secretary gavin williamson .

`` the uk government has signed a memorandum of intent with the kingdom of saudi arabia to aim to finalise discussions for the purchase of 48 typhoon aircraft , '' bae said in a brief statement to the london stock exchange .
`` this is a positive step towards agreeing a contract for our valued partner .
we are committed to supporting the kingdom as it modernises the saudi armed forces and develops key industrial capabilities . ''
bae 's share price jumped 2 % on the news .
the uk government holds a strategic stake in bae , which is europe 's biggest defence contractor .

documents.title: us jobs report 'will put brakes on dollar '
text: as we reported earlier the us added a chunky 313,000 jobs in february but wage growth slowed .
the pay figures suggest calls for `` four rate rises this year may well be a little bit premature '' , says michael hewson of cmc markets .
`` the fact that we saw wage growth slow to 2.6 % from 2.9 % would suggest that there is much more slack in this particular jobs market than most people think .
`` this is likely to prompt a little bit of a brake on the us dollar rebound we 've seen this week . ''
the dollar is currently 0.1 % lower against the euro at 0.8115 euros .

documents.title: us tariffs : what do we need to know ?
text: us tariffs : what do we need to know ?

documents.title: gkn and dana agree auto-engineering merger for $ 6.1bn
text: uk engineering giant gkn has agreed to merge part of its business with us company dana , as it seeks to fend off a takeover bid from melrose industries .
the merger will combine gkn 's driveline division with us auto-engineer dana in a deal worth $ 6.1bn ( £ 4.4bn ) .
it comes as melrose has a £ 7.4bn offer on the table to buy all of gkn .
but gkn said the dana deal `` provides significantly greater value '' than melrose 's bid , which is subject to scrutiny by uk mps and regulators .
read more

documents.title: toys r us 'preparing to close all us outlets '
text: shares in us toy firms have fallen on reports toys r us is considering closing all of its us stores .
the firm 's us arm filed for bankruptcy protection in the us and canada last year in a bid to shore up its finances .
but bloomberg has reported it is now preparing to liquidate its operations , quoting sources familiar with the matter .
shares in toy-makers hasbro and mattel are down 3.6 % and 9 % respectively .
toys r us 's uk subsidiary went into administration in february .

documents.title: us stocks open higher on strong jobs figures
text: wall street has opened higher after official data showed us jobs growth hit an 18-month high in february .
a slowdown in wage growth also pointed to a gradual rise in inflation , tempering expectations of faster interest rate increases .
a short while ago the dow jones index was up 0.6 % at 25,050.17 , while the s & p500 had gained 0.5 % to 2,738.97 .
the nasdaq had advanced 0.7 % to 7,476.80 .

documents.title: robot holiday
text: who said robots do n't need brakes ?
flippy the burger-flipper has been taken offline at a californian restaurant after just one day - because it was too slow .
cali burger planned to replace human cooks with flippy at its pasadena outlet .
it is being upgraded to cook more quickly ( and has n't even demanded a pay rise ) .
flippy was unavailable for comment .

documents.title: wake up once more
text: business editor simon jack tweets :
listen to my colleagues from the excellent wake up to money in a great series of podcasts .
here 's a sample .

documents.title: 'pharma bro ' shkreli to be sentenced for defrauding investors
text: notorious `` pharma bro '' martin shkreli is due to be sentenced for fraud on friday .
the former drug company boss made headlines by jacking up the price of a lifesaving drug before he was found guilty of defrauding investors .
shkreli , 34 , is expected to appear before us district judge kiyo matsumoto in federal court in brooklyn , new york .
his lawyers have asked the judge to impose a sentence of 12 to 18 months , while prosecutors have sought at least 15 years .

documents.title: us jobs boosted by construction
text: that us jobs number is the biggest increase in more than one and a half years , but a slowdown in wage growth pointed to a gradual increase in inflation this year .
nonfarm payrolls were boosted by the largest gain in construction jobs since 2007 , the labor department said .
but average hourly earnings edged up four cents , or 0.1 % , to $ 26.75 in february , a slowdown from a 0.3 % rise in january .
that lowered the year-on-year increase in average hourly earnings to 2.6 % from 2.8 % in january .

documents.title: breakingus economy creates 313,000 jobs in february
text: the us economy created 313,000 jobs last month , according to the latest report from the labor department .
the report is closely watched as a barometer of the health of the us economy and feeds into expectations about future interest rate moves .

documents.title: spotify seeks fraud chief
text: fancy a new job ?
spotify is looking for a head of fraud prevention .
the music streaming site , which is gearing up for an unusual listing on the nyse , has been the target of fraudsters .
music business worldwide recently reported that a bulgarian playlist-maker scammed the spotify payout system for several months last year and could have made as much as $ 1m in the process .

documents.title: breakinggkn agrees automotive merger with dana
text: gkn has agreed to merge its auto parts business with us firm dana in a deal worth $ 6.1bn .
you might remember that gkn is fighting off a hostile takeover bid from melrose industries .
it will be interesting to see how melrose reacts to this development .
on tuesday executives from gkn and melrose ( see our business live page around 09:30 ) also appeared before a panel of mps to answer questions about the deal .
during that hearing a founder of melrose said that gkn is a `` business that has lost its way , partly from the way that is is managed '' .

documents.title: how much does the rock make ?
text: it 's rare to get detailed information on the economics of the movie business .
but the wall street journal has seen the terms requested for a movie project starring dwayne `` the rock '' johnson .
the film , called red notice , attracted some of the highest bids of any new film project in recent years , according to the report .
mr johnson wanted $ 20m , plus 30 % of the movie 's profits .
there 's no script for the film yet , but the producers said it could cost up $ 160m to make .
despite that , universal pictures bought red notice based on a pitch of about 40 minutes , the journal reported .

documents.title: 'not much good news '
text: not much good news in today 's output data .
construction and extraction continued to weigh on quarterly growth .
manufacturing slowed too .
that said , manuf .
is still recording a decent pace of growth , and extraction should continue recover from the dec. forties pipeline closure .

documents.title: is netflix worth it ?
text: today 's stock market surprise is that netflix shares have soared almost two thirds since the start of the year and closed at $ 317 in new york last night .
three brokerages have raised their price targets this week , with pivotal research rising by $ 100 to $ 400 , while ubs raised its target by $ 50 to $ 345 .
however , one of the top-rated analysts for the stock , stifel 's scott devitt , cut netflix from `` buy '' to `` hold '' on thursday while raising his target to $ 325 from a previous $ 283 .
`` we are attracted to netflix 's business and competitive position but believe share price may have sprinted ahead of fundamentals in the short-term , '' he said .
and for more on why queer eye is proving a hit with viewers , click here .

documents.title: thorburn quits pra
text: scotland business editor douglas fraser tweets :
david thorburn , ex-ceo clydesdale bank , quits bank of england prudential regulation committee after 3 yrs , to return to the private sector - though not saying yet what he 's going to do .
the sfa ?

documents.title: bitcoin dips
text: bitcoin has fallen below $ 9,000 after something of a rollercoaster week following moves by us and japanese regulators to tighten their grip on crypto-currencies .
it 's down 4 % today to $ 8,947 according to coindesk .

zhou xiaochuan , governor of the people 's bank of china , has also had a pop : `` we do n't like the idea of creating a speculative product that prompts people to fantasise about striking it rich overnight .
this is not a good thing . ''

earlier this week japan 's financial regulator punished seven crypto-currency exchanges , suspending business at two of them , to bolster consumer protection in the wake of a $ 530m theft from tokyo-based coincheck .

documents.title: ubs eyes frankfurt moves
text: ubs has told employees in a memo it will take a `` decentralised '' approach to relocating staff following the brexit decision , with the majority of those affected moving to frankfurt .
staff affected will be informed in the next few months and while relocations will depend on where clients are , most of the moves will be to frankfurt , according to memo .
a ubs spokesman has confirmed the contents of the memo .

documents.title: you do the math
text: financial times editor lionel barber points out this gem of a letter from a us sixth grader in today 's paper .
ouch !
letter of the week : sixth-grader calls out the editor for failing the maths test
sign him up
in the language of the yoof , you 've just been roasted .
and , of course , the revelation that there is a real place in maryland called 'chevy chase '
why would an american sixth-grader call it maths ?
cause it was n't written by an american or a 6th grader
read the letter here :
was one calculation made using an american billion ( one thousand million ) and the other using the english billion ( one million million ? )
he called wrote maths '' .
and americans are now saying cars '' .
the plan to be greece to their rome is at last bearing fruit .
are n't american billions different from british billions by a factor of ten ?
6th-grader read financial times ?
american uses the term `` maths '' ?
i call foul .
`` sixth-grader '' is 15 ?

documents.title: british steel warns over 'dumping grounds '
text: british steel has responded to the prospect of tariffs on exports to the us .
it is worried that if international producers are priced out of the us market , then they will be forced to sell their steel at knock-down prices elsewhere .

`` us sales represent a small percentage of our exports and while disappointed by the announcement , we look forward to working with our valued american customers to fully understand the implications of section 232 .

`` tariffs will impact on the world market so we 'll continue working directly with the uk government , and uk steel , on this matter and to ensure britain and europe do n't again become dumping grounds for cheap steel . ''

documents.title: black panther strikes again
text: black panther is set to dominate the us box office for the fourth consecutive weekend , bringing its domestic haul to more than half a billion dollars , according to boxofficepro .

the marvel studios film , which is billed as the first black super hero movie , is expected to take almost $ 40m between today and sunday , bringing its us total to $ 560m since its release on 16 february .
a wrinkle in time - disney 's latest live action adaptation - is the only film released this weekend that could unthrone black panther from its top spot .

but boxofficepro says that is unlikely to happen : `` unfortunately , social media buzz has stalled in recent weeks as much of the film 's target audience remains enamored by black panther and its incredible word of mouth . ''
in the uk the film has taken just over £ 35m in three weeks .

documents.title: tax blacklist additions
text: european finance ministers are set to add the bahamas , the us virgin islands and st kitts and nevis to an eu list of jurisdictions that are deemed to facilitate tax avoidance .

reuters reports the document , which the ministers are expected to approve on tuesday , also adds anguilla , the british virgin islands , dominica and antigua and barbuda to a `` grey list '' of jurisdictions that do not respect eu anti-tax avoidance standards but have committed to change their practices .

documents.title: 'toxic combination '
text: rising interest rates and brexit uncertainty are proving to be a toxic combination for the construction sector , says samuel tombs at pantheon macroeconomics
`` the sharp decline in output in january primarily reflected an 8.3 % month-to-month collapse in new work in the private housing sector , '' he writes .
`` we doubt that housebuilding will recover fully soon ; the housing activity index of the construction pmi rose only to 51.2 in february , having fallen to 48.1 in january from 55.3 in december .
the prospect of further increases in interest rates is subduing buyer demand both for new and existing homes . ''
new work in the private commercial sector fell by 3.9 % , while last week 's bad weather almost certainly depressed construction activity , mr tombs adds .

documents.title: stiff drink required ?
text: shares in conviviality , the owner of chains including bargain booze , crashed almost 60 % yesterday following its shock profits warning .
things are n't looking much better today for the company as the stock is down another 11 % to 109p a share .
that 's despite chief executive diane hunter wading in to buy 44,176 shares at 114p apiece .
that means she 's already lost about £ 2,200 on her £ 50,000 investment .

documents.title: jcb needs 600 extra staff to meet demand
text: the construction equipment maker , jcb is looking to hire 600 extra staff .
the firm says it is experiencing `` unprecedented '' demand and needs welders , paint sprayers and assembly workers .
initially the roles will be filled using agency workers , but jcb says some workers are likely to be made permanent staff .
new staff will be paid a minimum of £ 10.40 per hour .

documents.title: breakinghousebuilding slide hits construction
text: things are looking grim in the construction sector in january , with output plunging 3.4 % compared with december , when there was a 1.6 % rise .
the decline - far worse than expected - was driven largely by a fall in housebuilding , while commercial construction output also fell sharply .
those figures are from the office for national statistics .

documents.title: uk trade deficit widens on fuel trading
text: the uk 's trade deficit in goods and services widened in the three months to january 2018 to £ 8.7bn , from £ 5.3bn in the previous period .
that deterioration was mainly due to an increase in imports of fuels and a decrease in exports of fuels .
that 's according to the latest figures from the office for national statistics .
the ons notes that these figures coincide with the closure of a key oil pipeline in scotland .
but the ons said it did not have `` direct evidence '' that the closure had affected its figures .

documents.title: breakingindustrial output rebounds
text: uk industrial output rose 1.3 % in january , compared with a 1.3 % fall in december , according to ons figures .
however , the increase was lower than the 1.5 % rise expected by analysts .
manufacturing output was up 0.1 % - down from a 0.3 % rise in december and also below the 0.2 % increase expected .

documents.title: could the uk become a socialist country ?
text: john mcdonnell , the shadow chancellor , has said that britain could become a `` socialist country '' .
he said it was time for radical changes on investment and tax to make the uk fairer and more equal , and `` rescue '' public services .
in an interview with the bbc ahead of the spring statement next week , mr mcdonnell said that philip hammond should use the opportunity to announce the end of austerity .
and that the government should say it would spend more on public services - particularly children 's services , which he said were facing a £ 2bn funding crisis .
more from kamal here .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: wagamama caught out by uniform confusion
text: restaurant chain wagamama is one of 180 firms named by the government for failing to pay the minimum wage .
`` this is unfortunate , '' thomas heier ( the human resources director at wagamama , told the bbc 's business live .
wagamama had asked staff to wear black trousers or skirts and black shoes , along with a top supplied by the company .
however that was considered a type of uniform , so the restaurant chain was fined by authorities .
mr heier said the company has reimbursed staff as far back as 2013 and has introduced a uniform supplement payment .

documents.title: inmarsat cuts divi
text: inmarsat is one of the biggest faller on the ftse 250 today after the satellite company it said it would cut the dividend for 2018 and beyond to fund higher investment in its aviation division .
shares are down about 4 % at 445.6p , valuing the company at just over £ 2bn .
cineworld is currently the biggest riser , up 3.3 % .

documents.title: gvc lays its bets
text: foxy bingo owner gvc has reported higher annual revenues as it gears up to complete its £ 4bn takeover of rival ladbrokes coral .

sales jumped 24 % to €896m ( £ 799m ) last year as it reaped the benefits of an earlier acquisition of bwin , increased mobile betting and a strong performance by its party poker brand , while pre-tax losses narrowed from €173.5m ( £ 154.8m ) to €25.6m .
chief executive kenneth alexander says gvc 's deal to buy ladbrokes represents an `` exciting opportunity '' .

the deal to buy ladbrokes follows two previous attempts at a combination between the pair , with discussions breaking down in the summer over price and amid uncertainty ahead of the government 's gambling review .
however , shareholders in both firms have approved the deal , which awaits regulatory clearance .
if approved the tie-up will create a global gambling giant , combining ladbrokes ' high street and online operations with gvc 's brands including sportingbet and partycasino .

documents.title: obamas in tv talks with netflix - cnn
text: along with the new york times , cnn are also reporting that barack obama is in talks with netflix .
cnn says for the former us president might appear on television as a `` moderator '' of a new series , or he might stay off camera as a producer .
the show would be about `` uplifting american stories '' and would involve his wife michelle , the report says .
cnn quotes a source as saying that netflix and mr obama are talking about a `` production partnership '' .

documents.title: which came first ?
text: business presenter sean farrington tweets :
`` so kfc no longer have their chickens in the one basket ? ''
says one listener who texted in @ twitterid

a sensible solution and well handled by bidvest - a cautionary tale and a very current one for businesses that increasingly use centralised procurement to buy specialised services without enough sector understanding - price is n't the only important variable - time for a rethink
what
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: breakingiod chair suspended
text: the institute of directors has suspended its chair , lady judge , as it examines claims made about her conduct that include racist , sexist and bullying behaviour
it has issued a one-line statement this morning :
`` the council took the decision , having received the hill dickinson executive summary , to suspend the iod chair pending further investigation into the matters raised and the process . ''

documents.title: ftse struggles
text: the london market has posted very modest gains on the final trading day of the week , up a princely 2 points at 7,206 .

documents.title: obamas 'strike netflix deal '
text: there 's been much speculation as to what barack obama might do next .
the new york times appears to have the answer : it reports that the former us president is in advanced talks with netflix to produce a series of high-profile shows .
according to its sources , mr obama and former first lady michelle obama will produce exclusive content that highlight `` inspirational stories '' on the video streaming service .
netflix declined to comment .
apple and amazon have also expressed interest in talking to obama about content deals , according to the new york times .
last year , penguin random house landed a deal to publish two books by barack obama and michelle obama , with one volume to be written by each .
the deal followed a heated auction for global rights to the two books with bidding that reached a record $ 60m , the financial times reported last year .

documents.title: steel market could be 'destabilised '
text: president trump has signed two declarations that will see tariffs on imported steel and aluminium products imposed in about a fortnight .
steel imports will be hit with a 25 % tariff and aluminium takes a 10 % hit .
but the trump administration may have `` shot itself in the foot '' , says gareth stace of the eef , the association which represents manufacturers .
that 's because the us may not be able to meet demand for steel from its domestic producers .
if so us steel customers could face a 25 % rise in prices .
that 's particularly the case with uk exports to the us which are specialised steel .
mr stace tells today the steel market could be `` destabilised '' as the makers of 25 million tonnes of steel seek new buyers .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: come fly with me ?
text: business presenter ben thompson tweets :
oh and if you 're wanting to get your hands on one , the price starts at £ 268,000
really ?
put me down for a couple then , cheers !
hmmm must remember to do the lottery
could a flying car be the answer to our gridlocked roads ?
it 's one of the vehicles getting a lot of attention at this year 's geneva motor show .
i 'll take a look at 0750 on @ twitterid
i watched the jetsons '' on tv when i was s boy , took a while but now fantasy is reality
flying cars with plenty of legroom for you # tallpersonproblem
imagine a london traffic gridlock , but this time it 's 100 metres in the air .
seattle needs them !
those rotors would play havoc with the high street first floor windows !
could be a cure for the remaining 1960 's architecture !
could a flying car be the answer to our gridlocked roads ?
no
bet i 'd still be late !
ladies and some gentleman parallel park that i hope the sat nav works ladies i am joking obviously..
some people flying drones are causing air issues , so these would be a nightmare !
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: bankruptcy looms for claire 's stores
text: claire 's stores , the accessories retailer , is set to go into bankruptcy protection in the coming weeks , bloomberg is reporting .
the retailer , which has 4,220 stores in 45 countries , has $ 2bn debt and was bought by the private equity firm apollo in 2007 for $ 3.1bn .
since then it has struggled to remain profitable and a plan to float the firm last year was abandoned .
under the plan its lenders including elliott capital management and monarch alternative capital would take control , according to bloomberg .
apollo declined to comment on the report .

documents.title: 'racism has n't gone away '
text: binna kandola , a visiting professor at leeds university business school , is the author of a new book called racism at work : the danger of indifference .
he tells today that racism has n't gone away '' .
while overt racism is no longer tolerated in the workplace , it has mutated to become more subtle and he fears that employers are not sufficiently alert to the problem .
managers often make assumptions about employees ' abilities based on their ethnicity , mr kandola argues .
while it may sound trivial , consistently failing to make eye contact with someone in a meeting can undermine confidence .
similarly , he says people from ethnic minorities can also be criticised too much and not get praise when it 's merited , leaving them feeling undermined .
he calls on business leaders to pay more attention to these issues and model the behaviours they expect of others in their organisation .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: papers : iod , channel 4 , bargain booze
text: there is much reporting this morning of the `` turmoil '' at one of the uk 's best known business groups , the institute of directors ( iod ) .
it surrounds barbara judge , who has stepped aside as chairwoman , following an investigation into her conduct .
according to the financial times she has accused the council which leads the iod of `` smearing '' her .
the ft says the organisation is in `` turmoil '' .
the telegraph reports that uk cities have been invited by the broadcaster channel 4 to bid to host its new national headquarters .
two smaller `` creative hubs '' are also available .
channel 4 has been pressured by the government to move jobs out of london .
and the times business section notes that shares in the owner of bargain booze tumbled 60 % on thursday after it warned of an error in its financial forecasts .
bargain booze is owned by conviviality , which employs 2,639 people .
its franchisees have more than 700 stores .

documents.title: ryanair to insert brexit rider in ticket terms
text: ryanair has told wake up to money that some airlines are being complacent about brexit .
its chief marketing officer kenny jacobs told wake up to money that he expect some kind of deal to be worked out in time .
nevertheless , ryanair is making contingency plans .
it has already slowed down its growth in services from the uk since the referendum vote of 2016 .
from september 2018 , ryanair is going to include a warning in the terms and conditions of its tickets .
it will read : `` this flight is subject to the regulatory environment allowing the flight to take place . ''
it would cover ryanair in the event of a worst case scenario , where there was no agreement between the eu and the uk over how to manage air traffic after brexit .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: kfc goes back to bidvest
text: why did kfc cross the road ?
to return to its old chicken supplier , it would seem .
yes , the fast food chain has decided to use bidvest , which used to supply its fresh chicken , to supply up to 350 of its 900 restaurants .
bidvest was dumped in favour of dhl last month by kfc - and we all know how that turned out .
a `` seamless return '' is being promised by bidvest .
more here .

documents.title: remember last month 's market 'tantrum ' ?
text: later on friday the us labor department releases its monthly report on the us jobs market .
richard hunter , head of markets at interactive investor reminds us that last month the figures triggered a `` tantrum '' on the financial markets .
in particular it was strong figures on wage growth that wrong-footed the markets .
wage growth is seen as an indicator of inflation and any signs of rising inflation could prompt us officials to raise interest rates more quickly than had been thought .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: myer falls out of asx 200
text: bricks and mortar retailers such as walmart have taken a beating in recent years as customers increasingly turn online retailers like amazon .
things are no different in australia , where the sole listed department store has been removed from the benchmark asx200 index .
the retailer slipped off the index of australia 's top 200 public companies after its shares slid by 85 % since listing in 2009 .
back then myer was worth almost $ 1.9bn - but that is now down to just $ 300m .
author: Tim McDonald
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: why are assault rifles so popular in the us ?
text: gun control is again under discussion in the us after 14 people died in a school shooting in florida last month .
many people outside the us ca n't understand why it 's so easy to buy semi-automatic assault rifles .
`` that 's the most difficult to defend of anything we talk about , '' said larry hyatt who runs hyatt 's , the biggest independent gun shop in the us .
`` it is the most popular firearm or rifle that we sell . ''
so , why is that ?
`` the ammunition is inexpensive , it has low recoil , it is fun to shoot .
the stock is adjustable so any body size can operate it .
and it 's good for self defense , hunting , target shooting and in case all else fails and the government ca n't help in some disaster - it 's probably the survivalist gun . ''
`` this talk of a ban has been a huge advertisement for this gun '' .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to friday 's business live page .
president trump 's trade tariffs are likely to be one source of discussion today .
china called them a serious attack on the global trade system .
watch out for a key bit of economic news later - the latest us employment report .
last month strong wage growth rattled the markets .
and why do so many american 's buy powerful semi-automatic assault rifles ?
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
